titleStmt.title: A treatise of the Beatitudes. Or Christs happy men. By James Buck Bachelor of Divinitie, and vicar of Stradbrooke in Suffolke
titleStmt.author: Buck, James.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by Bernard Alsop and Thomas Fawcet] for [John Clarke and] William Cooke, neare Furnivalls Inne gate in Holbourne,

notesStmt.note: The six pages following 124 are numbered: [unnumbered], [unnumbered], 129, 131, 132, 132.

"Beati pauperes. The poore", "Beati lugentes. The mourner", "Beati mites. The meeke", "Beati qui esuriunt. The desirer", "Beati misericordes. The mercifull", "Beati mundo corde. The pure", "Beati pacifici. The peace-maker", and "Beati qui persecutionem patiuntur. The blessed sufferer" each has separate dated title page; pagination and register are continuous. The first four subsidiary imprints read "London, printed for Iohn Clark, and Wil: Cooke, 1637."; the last four read "London, printed by B.A. and T.F. for Iohn Clark, and Wil. Cooke. 1637.".
A variant of the edition with John Cooke's name in the general title page imprint.
In the British Library copy (formerly STC 3999), the date on the general title page has been altered by pen to 1638.
Identified as STC 3999 on UMI microfilm, reel 1570.
Reproductions of the originals in the Cambridge University Library and the British Library.
Appears at reel 1570 (British Library copy) and at reel 705 (Cambridge Univerity Library copy).
